subject: Re: Separate Test Cases within xml files
msgSnippet: Maybe you can take a look at Cactus framework. I m not sure if it can do what you re are expecting, but it could be a nice try.
messageBody:
Maybe you can take a look at Cactus framework. I'm not sure if it can
do what you're are expecting, but it could be a nice try.

http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/index.html

Regards,

Stephanie Levesque
SCJP

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "bengarbers <garbers@c...>"
<garbers@c...> wrote:
> Junit Group,
>
> This is more of a design question. I was inherited to take over
> testing a client / server application. The test cases were all
> written in xml (a bunch of xml defined messages that the client
would
> send to the server) where a java application would read in each
test
> case from the xml file. It would then send the xml message to the
> server and the server would then process that xml messages and send
> them back another xml message.
>
> I would like to integrate this into Junit's framework but the
> problem I am having is that each test case has 4 xml messages that
it
> sends to the server. I would like to use JUnits TestCase method
and
> read each xml file one by one. The problem with this is that it
> would be one method that would be reading each xml message in from
> the file and then verifying it.
>
> After looking at JUnit's framework they treat each method as a
> test case within a class that extends TestCase. My question is how
> would you design this so that I could treat each file as testcase 1
> and each message that gets read in as testcase a, b, c, etc.... I
> would like to be able to use Junit's swing TestRunner to run all
> these xml file test cases then. Any help would be greatly
> appreciated.
>
> ben
